info.title: Merge Accounting API
info.description: The unified API for building rich integrations with multiple Accounting & Finance platforms.

get.description: Get details for a linked account.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Returns the account token for the end user with the provided public token.

parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: include_deleted_data
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

parameters.name: include_shell_data
parameters.description: Whether to include shell records. Shell records are empty records (they may contain some metadata but all other fields are null).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description: Gets a list of audit trail events.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred before this time

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: If included, will only include events with the given event type. Possible values include: `CREATED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `DELETED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `CREATED_TEST_API_KEY`, `DELETED_TEST_API_KEY`, `REGENERATED_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `INVITED_USER`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_ENABLED`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_DISABLED`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_DESTINATION`, `DELETED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_SCOPES`, `CHANGED_PERSONAL_INFORMATION`, `CHANGED_ORGANIZATION_SETTINGS`, `ENABLED_INTEGRATION`, `DISABLED_INTEGRATION`, `ENABLED_CATEGORY`, `DISABLED_CATEGORY`, `CHANGED_PASSWORD`, `RESET_PASSWORD`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_COMMON_MODEL_OVERRIDE`, `CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_COMMON_MODEL_OVERRIDE`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_COMMON_MODEL_OVERRIDE`, `FORCED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_RESYNC`, `MUTED_ISSUE`, `GENERATED_MAGIC_LINK`, `ENABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `DISABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `MERGE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_CHANGED`, `END_USER_CREDENTIALS_ACCESSED`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred after this time

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: If provided, this will return events associated with the specified user email. Please note that the email address reflects the user's email at the time of the event, and may not be their current email.

parameters.description:
Options: `accounting`, `ats`, `crm`, `filestorage`, `hris`, `mktg`, `ticketing`

* `hris` - hris
* `ats` - ats
* `accounting` - accounting
* `ticketing` - ticketing
* `crm` - crm
* `mktg` - mktg
* `filestorage` - filestorage
* `datawarehouse` - datawarehouse

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_user_email_address
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given email address.

parameters.name: end_user_organization_name
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given organization name.

parameters.name: end_user_origin_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given origin ID.

parameters.name: end_user_origin_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of EndUser origin IDs, making it possible to specify multiple EndUsers at once.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of LinkedAccount IDs, making it possible to specify multiple LinkedAccounts at once.

parameters.name: include_duplicates
parameters.description: If `true`, will include complete production duplicates of the account specified by the `id` query parameter in the response. `id` must be for a complete production linked account.

parameters.name: integration_name
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given integration name.

parameters.name: is_test_account
parameters.description: If included, will only include test linked accounts. If not included, will only include non-test linked accounts.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status. Options: `COMPLETE`, `IDLE`, `INCOMPLETE`, `RELINK_NEEDED`

Account.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a company’s ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

type.description: The account's type is a narrower and more specific grouping within the account's classification.

account_type.description:
Normalized account type- which is a narrower and more specific grouping within the account's classification.

* `BANK` - BANK
* `CREDIT_CARD` - CREDIT_CARD
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `FIXED_ASSET` - FIXED_ASSET
* `OTHER_ASSET` - OTHER_ASSET
* `OTHER_CURRENT_ASSET` - OTHER_CURRENT_ASSET
* `OTHER_EXPENSE` - OTHER_EXPENSE
* `OTHER_INCOME` - OTHER_INCOME
* `COST_OF_GOODS_SOLD` - COST_OF_GOODS_SOLD
* `OTHER_CURRENT_LIABILITY` - OTHER_CURRENT_LIABILITY
* `LONG_TERM_LIABILITY` - LONG_TERM_LIABILITY
* `NON_POSTING` - NON_POSTING

status.description:
The account's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `PENDING` - PENDING
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

currency.description:
The account's currency.

* `XUA` - ADB Unit of Account
* `AFN` - Afghan Afghani
* `AFA` - Afghan Afghani (1927–2002)
* `ALL` - Albanian Lek
* `ALK` - Albanian Lek (1946–1965)
* `DZD` - Algerian Dinar
* `ADP` - Andorran Peseta
* `AOA` - Angolan Kwanza
* `AOK` - Angolan Kwanza (1977–1991)
* `AON` - Angolan New Kwanza (1990–2000)
* `AOR` - Angolan Readjusted Kwanza (1995–1999)
* `ARA` - Argentine Austral
* `ARS` - Argentine Peso
* `ARM` - Argentine Peso (1881–1970)
* `ARP` - Argentine Peso (1983–1985)
* `ARL` - Argentine Peso Ley (1970–1983)
* `AMD` - Armenian Dram
* `AWG` - Aruban Florin
* `AUD` - Australian Dollar

AccountDetailsAndActions.description:
# The LinkedAccount Object
### Description
The `LinkedAccount` object is used to represent an end user's link with a specific integration.

### Usage Example
View a list of your organization's `LinkedAccount` objects.

subdomain.description: The tenant or domain the customer has provided access to.

is_duplicate.description: Whether a Production Linked Account's credentials match another existing Production Linked Account. This field is `null` for Test Linked Accounts, incomplete Production Linked Accounts, and ignored duplicate Production Linked Account sets.

Example: Workforce Now (in lieu of ADP Workforce Now), SuccessFactors (in lieu of SAP SuccessFactors)

AccountRequest.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a company’s ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

type.description: The account's type is a narrower and more specific grouping within the account's classification.

x-merge-model-tooltip.title: Looking for __Bank Accounts__?
x-merge-model-tooltip.content: Bank Accounts are represented as an __Account__ with a `classification` of __ASSET__.

AccountingAttachment.description:
# The Accounting Attachment Object
### Description
The `AccountingAttachment` object is used to represent a company's attachments.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST AccountingAttachments` endpoint and view a company's attachments.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the accounting attachment belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

AccountingPeriod.description:
# The AccountingPeriod Object
### Description
The `AccountingPeriod` object is used to define a period of time in which events occurred.

### Usage Example
Common models like `Invoice` and `Transaction` will have `AccountingPeriod` objects which will denote when they occurred.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

AccountingPhoneNumber.description:
# The AccountingPhoneNumber Object
### Description
The `AccountingPhoneNumber` object is used to represent a contact's or company's phone number.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view the company's phone numbers.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

user_name.description: The User's full name at the time of this Event occurring.

user_email.description: The User's email at the time of this Event occurring.

role.description:
Designates the role of the user (or SYSTEM/API if action not taken by a user) at the time of this Event occurring.

* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

event_type.description:

AvailableActions.description:
# The AvailableActions Object
### Description
The `Activity` object is used to see all available model/operation combinations for an integration.

### Usage Example
Fetch all the actions available for the `Zenefits` integration.

BalanceSheet.description:
# The BalanceSheet Object
### Description
The `BalanceSheet` object shows a company’s assets, liabilities, and equity. Assets should be equal to liability and equity combined. This shows the company’s financial health at a specific point in time.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST BalanceSheets` endpoint and view a company's balance sheets.

company.description: `Company` object for the given `BalanceSheet` object.

date.description: The balance sheet's date. The balance sheet data will reflect the company's financial position this point in time.

remote_generated_at.description: The time that balance sheet was generated by the accounting system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

BankFeedAccount.description:
# The BankFeedAccount Object
### Description
The `BankFeedAccount` object represents a bank feed account, detailing various attributes including account identifiers, names, currency, and balance information. This object is central to managing and tracking bank feed accounts within the system.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BankFeedAccount` endpoint to view details of a bank feed account.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

source_account_id.description: The unique identifier of the source account from our customer’s platform.

target_account_id.description: The unique identifier of the target account from the third party software.

source_account_name.description: The name of the source account as stored in our customer’s platform.

source_account_number.description: The human-readable account number of the source account as stored in our customer’s platform.

target_account_name.description: The name of the target account from the third party software.

BankFeedAccountRequest.description:
# The BankFeedAccount Object
### Description
The `BankFeedAccount` object represents a bank feed account, detailing various attributes including account identifiers, names, currency, and balance information. This object is central to managing and tracking bank feed accounts within the system.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BankFeedAccount` endpoint to view details of a bank feed account.

source_account_id.description: The unique identifier of the source account from our customer’s platform.

target_account_id.description: The unique identifier of the target account from the third party software.

source_account_name.description: The name of the source account as stored in our customer’s platform.

source_account_number.description: The human-readable account number of the source account as stored in our customer’s platform.

target_account_name.description: The name of the target account from the third party software.

BankFeedTransaction.description:
# The BankFeedTransaction Object
### Description
The `BankFeedTransaction` object is used to represent transactions linked to a bank feed account. This includes details about the transaction such as the date, amount, description, and type.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BankFeedTransaction` endpoint to view details of a transaction associated with a bank feed account.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

bank_feed_account.description: The bank feed account associated with the transaction.

transaction_date.description: The date that the transaction occurred.

posted_date.description: The date the transaction was posted to the bank account.

transaction_type.description: The underlying type of the transaction.

payee.description: The person or merchant who initiated the transaction, or alternatively, to whom the transaction was paid.

credit_or_debit.description:
If the transaction is of type debit or credit.

* `CREDIT` - CREDIT
* `DEBIT` - DEBIT

source_transaction_id.description: The customer’s identifier for the transaction.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

is_processed.description: Whether or not this transaction has been processed by the external system. For example, NetSuite writes this field as True when the SuiteApp has processed the transaction.

CashFlowStatement.description:
# The CashFlowStatement Object
### Description
The `CashFlowStatement` object shows operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities over a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CashFlowStatements` endpoint and view a company's cash flow statements.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

CompanyInfo.description:
# The CompanyInfo Object
### Description
The `CompanyInfo` object contains information about the company of the linked account. If the company has multiple entities (also known as subsidiaries), each entity may show up as a single `CompanyInfo` record.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view a company's information.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

fiscal_year_end_month.description: The company's fiscal year end month.

fiscal_year_end_day.description: The company's fiscal year end day.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's company was created.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

Contact.description:
# The Contact Object
### Description
A `Contact` is an individual or business entity to which products and services are sold to or purchased from. The `Contact` model contains both Customers, in which products and services are sold to, and Vendors (or Suppliers), in which products and services are purchased from.
* A `Contact` is a Vendor/Supplier if the `is_supplier` property is true.
* A `Contact` is a customer if the `is_customer` property is true.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Contacts` endpoint and view a company's contacts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

is_supplier.description: Whether the contact is a supplier.

is_customer.description: Whether the contact is a customer.

currency.description: The currency the contact's transactions are in.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's contact was updated.

company.description: The company the contact belongs to.

addresses.description: `Address` object IDs for the given `Contacts` object.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

CreditNote.description:
# The CreditNote Object
### Description
A `CreditNote` is transaction issued to a customer, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed by the customer. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a sales transaction. A `CreditNote` can be applied to *Accounts Receivable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CreditNotes` endpoint and view a company's credit notes.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The credit note's status.

* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `PAID` - PAID

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

remaining_credit.description: The amount of value remaining in the credit note that the customer can use.

inclusive_of_tax.description: If the transaction is inclusive or exclusive of tax. `True` if inclusive, `False` if exclusive.

currency.description:
The credit note's currency.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's credit note was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's credit note was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the CreditNote was generated in.

applied_to_lines.description: A list of the CreditNote Applied to Lines common models related to a given Credit Note

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

CreditNoteApplyLineForCreditNote.description:
# The CreditNoteApplyLine Object
### Description
The `CreditNoteApplyLine` is attached to the CreditNote model.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CreditNote` endpoint and view the invoice's applied to lines.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_date.description: Date that the credit note is applied to the invoice.

applied_amount.description: The amount of the Credit Note applied to the invoice.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

# The CreditNoteLineItem Object
### Description
The `CreditNoteLineItem` object is used to represent a credit note's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CreditNote` endpoint and view the credit note's line items.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

name.description: The credit note line item's name.

description.description: The description of the item that is owed.

quantity.description: The credit note line item's quantity.

memo.description: The credit note line item's memo.

unit_price.description: The credit note line item's unit price.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate that applies to this line item.

total_line_amount.description: The credit note line item's total.

tracking_category.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking categories.

account.description: The credit note line item's account.

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

DataPassthroughRequest.description:
# The DataPassthrough Object
### Description
The `DataPassthrough` object is used to send information to an otherwise-unsupported third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
Create a `DataPassthrough` to get team hierarchies from your Rippling integration.

path.description: The path of the request in the third party's platform.

base_url_override.description: An optional override of the third party's base url for the request.

data.description: The data with the request. You must include a `request_format` parameter matching the data's format

multipart_form_data.description: Pass an array of `MultipartFormField` objects in here instead of using the `data` param if `request_format` is set to `MULTIPART`.

headers.description: The headers to use for the request (Merge will handle the account's authorization headers). `Content-Type` header is required for passthrough. Choose content type corresponding to expected format of receiving server.

normalize_response.description: Optional. If true, the response will always be an object of the form `{"type": T, "value": ...}` where `T` will be one of `string, boolean, number, null, array, object`.

Employee.description:
# The Employee Object
### Description
An `Employee` is an individual who works for the company of the linked account. The `Employee` model contains both contractors and full time employees.
* An `Employee` is a contractor if `is_contractor` property is `True`
* An `Employee` is a full time employee if `is_contractor` property is `False`

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employees` endpoint and view a company's employees.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

is_contractor.description: `True` if the employee is a contractor, `False` if not.

company.description: The subsidiary that the employee belongs to.

status.description:
The employee's status in the accounting system.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

end_user_email_address.description: Your end user's email address. This is purely for identification purposes - setting this value will not cause any emails to be sent.

end_user_origin_id.description: This unique identifier typically represents the ID for your end user in your product's database. This value must be distinct from other Linked Accounts' unique identifiers.

categories.description: The integration categories to show in Merge Link.

integration.description: The slug of a specific pre-selected integration for this linking flow token. For examples of slugs, see https://docs.merge.dev/guides/merge-link/single-integration/.

link_expiry_mins.description: An integer number of minutes between [30, 720 or 10080 if for a Magic Link URL] for how long this token is valid. Defaults to 30.

should_create_magic_link_url.description: Whether to generate a Magic Link URL. Defaults to false. For more information on Magic Link, see https://merge.dev/blog/integrations-fast-say-hello-to-magic-link.

hide_admin_magic_link.description: Whether to generate a Magic Link URL on the Admin Needed screen during the linking flow. Defaults to false. For more information on Magic Link, see https://merge.dev/blog/integrations-fast-say-hello-to-magic-link.

common_models.description: An array of objects to specify the models and fields that will be disabled for a given Linked Account. Each object uses model_id, enabled_actions, and disabled_fields to specify the model, method, and fields that are scoped for a given Linked Account.

category_common_model_scopes.description: When creating a Link Token, you can set permissions for Common Models that will apply to the account that is going to be linked. Any model or field not specified in link token payload will default to existing settings.

language.description:
The following subset of IETF language tags can be used to configure localization.

* `en` - en
* `de` - de

are_syncs_disabled.description: The boolean that indicates whether initial, periodic, and force syncs will be disabled.

integration_specific_config.description: A JSON object containing integration-specific configuration options.

detail.example: custom_fields is a required field on model.

Expense.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

currency.description:

ExpenseLine.description:
# The ExpenseLine Object
### Description
The `ExpenseLine` object is used to represent an expense's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view the expense's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

tracking_categories.description: The expense line item's associated tracking categories.

employee.description: The employee this overall transaction relates to.

ExpenseRequest.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

currency.description:
The expense's currency.

GeneralLedgerTransaction.description:
# The GeneralLedgerTransaction Object
### Description
A General Ledger Entry is a record of a financial transaction that is posted to the general ledger, the central repository of a company’s financial data.

The `GeneralLedgerTransaction` object is a singular endpoint to pull all transactions posted to a company’s general ledger. The transaction that generated the `GeneralLedgerTransaction` can be found by referencing the `underlying_transaction_type` and `underlying_transaction_remote_id` fields.

The lines of a `GeneralLedgerTransaction` object will always have equal amounts of debits and credits.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET GeneralLedgerTransaction` endpoint and view a general ledger transaction.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

underlying_transaction_remote_id.description: The third party remote ID of the underlying transaction.

underlying_transaction_type.description:
The type of the underlying transaction.

* `INVOICE` - INVOICE
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `TRANSACTION` - TRANSACTION

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the GeneralLedgerTransaction was generated in.

company.description: The company the GeneralLedgerTransaction belongs to.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's GeneralLedgerTransaction entry was updated.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's GeneralLedgerTransaction entry was created.

posting_date.description: The date that the transaction was posted to the general ledger.

general_ledger_transaction_lines.description: A list of “General Ledger Transaction Applied to Lines” objects.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

GeneralLedgerTransactionLine.description:
# The GeneralLedgerTransactionLineSerializer Object
### Description
The `GeneralLedgerTransactionLineSerializer` object represents general ledger transaction line item.

### Usage Example Fetch from the `GET GeneralLedgerTransactionLineSerializer` endpoint and view an
`GeneralLedgerTransaction` line item.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the GeneralLedgerTransaction belongs to.

GenerateRemoteKeyRequest.description:
# The GenerateRemoteKey Object
### Description
The `GenerateRemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to create a new remote key.

name.description: The name of the remote key

IncomeStatement.description:
# The IncomeStatement Object
### Description
The `IncomeStatement` object is used to represent a company’s income, the cost of sales, operating expenses, and other non-operating expenses. The object also includes other important values like gross profit, gross operating profit, and net income. This represents a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET IncomeStatement` endpoint and view a company's income statement for a given period.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

Invoice.description:
# The Invoice Object
### Description
The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer or bought from a vendor.


Represents a Bill when the `Invoice` type is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`. References an Invoice when the `Invoice` type is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

company.description: The company the invoice belongs to.

employee.description: The employee this overall transaction relates to.

The invoice's currency.

status.description:
The status of the invoice.

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED

* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `VOID` - VOID

total_tax_amount.description: The total amount being paid in taxes.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's invoice entry was updated.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Invoice was generated in.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

inclusive_of_tax.description: If the transaction is inclusive or exclusive of tax. `True` if inclusive, `False` if exclusive.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

InvoiceLineItem.description:
# The InvoiceLineItem Object
### Description
The `InvoiceLineItem` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Invoice` endpoint and view the invoice's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

InvoiceRequest.description:
# The Invoice Object
### Description
The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer or bought from a vendor.


Represents a Bill when the `Invoice` type is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`. References an Invoice when the `Invoice` type is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

employee.description: The employee this overall transaction relates to.

status.description:
The status of the invoice.

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `PARTIALLY_PAID` - PARTIALLY_PAID
* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `VOID` - VOID

company.description: The company the invoice belongs to.

currency.description:
The invoice's currency.

Item.description:
# The Item Object
### Description
The `Item` object refers to the goods involved in a transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Items` endpoint and view a company's items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

purchase_price.description: The price at which the item is purchased from a vendor.

purchase_account.description: References the default account used to record a purchase of the item.

sales_account.description: References the default account used to record a sale.

company.description: The company the item belongs to.

purchase_tax_rate.description: The default purchase tax rate for this item.

sales_tax_rate.description: The default sales tax rate for this item.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's item note was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

ItemFormatEnum.description:
* `string` - uuid
* `number` - url
* `date` - email
* `datetime` - phone
* `bool` - currency
* `list` - decimal

ItemTypeEnum.description:
* `string` - string
* `number` - number
* `date` - date
* `datetime` - datetime
* `bool` - bool
* `list` - list

JournalEntry.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
A `JournalEntry` is a record of a transaction or event that is entered into a company's accounting system.

The `JournalEntry` common model contains records that are automatically created as a result of a certain type of transaction, like an Invoice, and records that are manually created against a company’s ledger.

The lines of a given `JournalEntry` object should always sum to 0. A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative net_amount represents a credit.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

currency.description:

JournalEntryRequest.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
The `JournalEntry` object is used to get a record of all manually created entries made in a company’s general ledger. The journal line items for each journal entry should sum to zero.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

JournalLine.description:
# The JournalLine Object
### Description
The `JournalLine` object is used to represent a journal entry's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view the journal entry's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The value of the line item including taxes and other fees.

tracking_categories.description: The journal line item's associated tracking categories.

currency.description:
The journal line item's currency.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

JournalLineRequest.description:
# The JournalLine Object
### Description
The `JournalLine` object is used to represent a journal entry's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view the journal entry's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

net_amount.description: The value of the line item including taxes and other fees.

tracking_categories.description: The journal line item's associated tracking categories.

currency.description:

ModelOperation.description:
# The ModelOperation Object
### Description
The `ModelOperation` object is used to represent the operations that are currently supported for a given model.

### Usage Example
View what operations are supported for the `Candidate` endpoint.

MultipartFormFieldRequest.description:
# The MultipartFormField Object
### Description
The `MultipartFormField` object is used to represent fields in an HTTP request using `multipart/form-data`.

### Usage Example
Create a `MultipartFormField` to define a multipart form entry.

name.description: The name of the form field

data.description: The data for the form field.

encoding.description:
The encoding of the value of `data`. Defaults to `RAW` if not defined.

* `RAW` - RAW
* `BASE64` - BASE64
* `GZIP_BASE64` - GZIP_BASE64

file_name.description: The file name of the form field, if the field is for a file.

content_type.description: The MIME type of the file, if the field is for a file.

remote_field_traversal_path.description: The field traversal path of the remote field listed when you hit the GET /remote-fields endpoint.

remote_method.description: The method of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

remote_url_path.description: The path of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

PatchedPaymentRequest.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

Payment.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

PaymentLineItem.description:
# The PaymentLineItem Object
### Description
The `PaymentLineItem` object is an applied-to-line on a `Payment` that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

### Usage Example
`Payment` will have a field called `applied-to-lines` which will be an array of `PaymentLineItemInternalMappingSerializer` objects that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_amount.description: The amount being applied to the transaction.

applied_date.description: The date the payment portion is applied.

related_object_id.description: The Merge ID of the transaction the payment portion is being applied to.

related_object_type.description: The type of transaction the payment portion is being applied to. Possible values include: INVOICE, JOURNAL_ENTRY, or CREDIT_NOTE.

PaymentRequest.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

PurchaseOrder.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
A `PurchaseOrder` represents a request to purchase goods or services from a vendor. It outlines the details of the purchase, such as the items or services requested, quantities, prices, and delivery details.

A `PurchaseOrder` is a crucial component of the procurement process, but does not typically result in any impact on the company’s general ledger. The general ledger is typically only affected when the `PurchaseOrder` is fulfilled as an *Accounts Payable* `Invoice` object (also known as a Bill).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

purchase_order_number.description: The human-readable number of the purchase order.

customer.description: The contact making the purchase order.

vendor.description: The party fulfilling the purchase order.

memo.description: A memo attached to the purchase order.

company.description: The company the purchase order belongs to.

currency.description:
The purchase order's currency.

PurchaseOrderLineItem.description:
# The PurchaseOrderLineItem Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrderLineItem` object is used to represent a purchase order's line item.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET PurchaseOrder` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

PurchaseOrderRequest.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrder` object is a record of request for a product or service between a buyer and seller.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

customer.description: The contact making the purchase order.

vendor.description: The party fulfilling the purchase order.

memo.description: A memo attached to the purchase order.

company.description: The company the purchase order belongs to.

currency.description:
The purchase order's currency.

RemoteData.description:
# The RemoteData Object
### Description
The `RemoteData` object is used to represent the full data pulled from the third-party API for an object.

### Usage Example
TODO

path.description: The third-party API path that is being called.

data.description: The data returned from the third-party for this object in its original, unnormalized format.

RemoteKey.description:
# The RemoteKey Object
### Description
The `RemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to receive a new `RemoteKey`.

RemoteKeyForRegenerationRequest.description:
# The RemoteKeyForRegeneration Object
### Description
The `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` object is used to exchange an old remote key for a new one

### Usage Example
Post a `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` to swap out an old remote key for a new one

name.description: The name of the remote key

RemoteResponse.description:
# The RemoteResponse Object
### Description
The `RemoteResponse` object is used to represent information returned from a third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
View the `RemoteResponse` returned from your `DataPassthrough`.

ReportItem.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

RoleEnum.description:
* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

SyncStatus.description:
# The SyncStatus Object
### Description
The `SyncStatus` object is used to represent the syncing state of an account

### Usage Example
View the `SyncStatus` for an account to see how recently its models were synced.

SyncStatusStatusEnum.description:
* `SYNCING` - SYNCING
* `DONE` - DONE
* `FAILED` - FAILED
* `DISABLED` - DISABLED
* `PAUSED` - PAUSED
* `PARTIALLY_SYNCED` - PARTIALLY_SYNCED

TaxComponent.description:
# The TaxRate Object
### Description
The `TaxComponent` object is used to represent any sub-taxes that make up the `TaxRate`.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST TaxRates` endpoint and view tax components relevant to a tax rate.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

is_compound.description: Returns True if the tax component is compound, False if not.

component_type.description:
Returns PURCHASE if the tax component corresponds to a purchase tax or SALES if the tax component corresponds to a sales tax.

* `SALES` - SALES
* `PURCHASE` - PURCHASE

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

TaxRate.description:
# The TaxRate Object
### Description
The `TaxRate` object is used to represent a tax rate.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST TaxRates` endpoint and view tax rates relevant to a company.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The subsidiary that the tax rate belongs to (in the case of multi-entity systems).

code.description: The tax code associated with this tax rate or group of tax rates from the third-party platform.

status.description:
The tax rate’s status - `ACTIVE` if an active tax rate, `ARCHIVED` if not active.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED

country.description: The country the tax rate is associated with.

total_tax_rate.description: The tax’s total tax rate - sum of the tax components (not compounded).

effective_tax_rate.description: The tax rate’s effective tax rate - total amount of tax with compounding.

tax_components.description: The related tax components of the tax rate.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

TrackingCategory.description:
# The TrackingCategory Object
### Description
A `TrackingCategory` object represents a categorization method used to classify transactions within an accounting platform. They are often used to group records for reporting and analysis purposes. The most common types of `TrackingCategories` are Classes and Departments.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TrackingCategory` endpoint and view a company's tracking category.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The tracking category's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED

category_type.description:
The tracking category’s type.

* `CLASS` - CLASS
* `DEPARTMENT` - DEPARTMENT

company.description: The company the GeneralLedgerTransaction belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

Transaction.description:
# The Transaction Object
### Description
The `Transaction` common model includes records of all types of transactions that do not appear in other common models. The type of transaction can be identified through the type field. More specifically, it will contain all types of transactions outside of:
* __Credit Notes__
* __Expenses__
* __Invoices__
* __Journal Entries__
* __Payments__
* __Purchase Orders__
* __Vendor Credits__

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Transaction` endpoint and view a company's transactions.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

transaction_type.description: The type of transaction, which can by any transaction object not already included in Merge’s common model.

number.description: The transaction's number used for identifying purposes.

transaction_date.description: The date upon which the transaction occurred.

contact.description: The contact to whom the transaction relates to.

inclusive_of_tax.description: If the transaction is inclusive or exclusive of tax. `True` if inclusive, `False` if exclusive.

total_amount.description: The total amount being paid after taxes.

currency.description:
The transaction's currency.

TransactionLineItem.description:
# The TransactionLineItem Object
### Description
The `TransactionLineItem` object is used to represent a transaction's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TransactionLineItem` endpoint and view the transaction's line items.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

memo.description: An internal note used by the business to clarify purpose of the transaction.

tracking_categories.description: The transaction line item's associated tracking categories.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate that applies to this line item.

VendorCredit.description:
# The VendorCredit Object
### Description
A `VendorCredit` is transaction issued by a vendor to the accounting company, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed to the vendor. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a purchasing transaction. A `VendorCredit` can be applied to `Accounts Payable` Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the `Invoice`.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view a company's vendor credits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

VendorCreditApplyLineForInvoice.description:
# The VendorCreditApplyLine Object
### Description
The `VendorCreditApplyLine` object is used to represent a applied vendor credit.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view the vendor credit's applied to lines.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_date.description: Date that the vendor credit is applied to the invoice.

applied_amount.description: The amount of the VendorCredit applied to the invoice.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform. Full coverage deletion detection is a premium add-on. Native deletion detection is offered for free with limited coverage. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/integrations/hris/supported-features/).

VendorCreditLine.description:
# The VendorCreditLine Object
### Description
The `VendorCreditLine` object is used to represent a vendor credit's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view the vendor credit's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The full value of the credit.

tracking_categories.description: The vendor credit line item's associated tracking categories.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate that applies to this line item.

exchange_rate.description: The vendor credit line item's exchange rate.

VendorCreditRequest.description:
# The VendorCredit Object
### Description
A `VendorCredit` is transaction issued by a vendor to the accounting company, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed to the vendor. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a purchasing transaction. A `VendorCredit` can be applied to `Accounts Payable` Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the `Invoice`.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view a company's vendor credits.

vendor.description: The vendor that owes the gift or refund.

currency.description:
The vendor credit's currency.
